page.title: 01Newburgh And The Local Area
page.content: This is a rural area where farming dominates the landscape.The land is generally flat with only a few gentle slopes the highest point being 61 metres above sea level.As it is also a coastal area there are very few trees.Part of the river Ythan flows through this area before it reaches the North Sea.Since the land is used mainly for farming there are only two villages Newburgh and Tipperty. Newburgh which has grown in size over recent years.Tipperty which has remained fairly small.There are 11 farms within this area. The main Aberdeen Peterhead road the A92 passes through the area.The Newburgh Pitmedden road the B9000 joins up Newburgh with the main A92. The oldest buildings are the Krypt built in 1300 and Knockhall Castle built in 1565, both are in Newburgh.
